website_summaries.verdict: This game promotes satisfaction and togetherness by posing over 300 cozy questions to friends and family. A unique and gratifying activity for parties and family gatherings.
pros: A portable, fun game for groups of people
A gateway to sharing conversation about topics you might not otherwise discuss
It's designed for older children and adults
cons: It's not so much a "game" with an objective and opponents as it is an activity meant to spark conversation
If you're looking for competition, this isn't the right choice

customer_reviews.title: Just Ask Your Own Questions.... Duh
customer_reviews.text: If you can think up questions to ask people by yourself, then you don’t need this “game.” It’s just a deck of question cards. And some of the questions are less hygge and more confrontational — “What are your parents best and worst qualities?” Really? I’m not going to discuss that at the Thanksgiving dinner table! “Hey, Mom, I like your sense of humor but you’re not so bright!” Uh, no...
customer_reviews.author: Connie Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: We enjoyed playing this “game” fireside with family over the holidays
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed playing this “game” fireside with family over the holidays, with hot drinks and candles lit. It isn’t meant to be funny, but of course it can sometimes be! It was wonderful to move the conversation into areas where normally we don’t venture. I felt like it helped us to feel closer as a family. Of course that’s exactly the spirit of hygge! I would heartily recommend :)
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: It's kind of cool
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty neat but it is more or less just googling "random things to talk about" and printing it on a card. My wife and I use it sometimes at night before bed just to talk about something random if work has fried both our brains but we need some "together time." The smart phone kind of makes it obsolete but having the physical form is nice sometimes and can help you put your phone down and focus on the conversation instead of opening another app while you talk
customer_reviews.author: Newegg B.

customer_reviews.title: Hygge

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get people talking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for a friend whose home I stay at often. We enjoying cooking and hosting dinner parties for friends. Plenty of cards, each with three questions, some more “personal” than others. Know your audience’s comfort level before asking some (like any discussion). Looking forward to many more evenings with these. Good price, nice presentation.

customer_reviews.title: My kids and I love this game.
customer_reviews.text: My kids are a little young, they're eight (twins). But they still love it. It's a great way to open conversations and learn new things about people, especially on topics you might not normally discuss. Some of the questions had us like, "Wait, what? That is cozy how?" Like there was a leading question about people on welfare and work requirements. So some of them were like, more like "Spark a fight with your friends and neighbors!" questions. But most of the questions made sense for what the game is about.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lochner

customer_reviews.title: A favorite at social nights
customer_reviews.text: My school hosts monthly game nights, and the Hygge Game has become a favorite, especially when meeting new people. Some of the questions are bland, but most really make you think.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaus Grimsby

customer_reviews.title: Not Really A Game. Good Idea though...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a game really. It's just a lot of random questions - three per card. I could have sat down and spent a few hours writing my own and saved a few bucks, however it is a good idea and can be useful as an ice-breaker and/or get to know someone type of method.
customer_reviews.author: sbrosman

customer_reviews.title: Great conversation starter
customer_reviews.text: Unless we are talking about something super geeky, my partner isn't exactly very talkative at the dinner table. In an effort to make our mealtimes more connective, I bought this and placed it in our dining room. We have been taking turns reading a card and asking each other questions while we eat together. Hygge has been a fantastic starting point for some great conversations! The questions are simple but interesting, so they don't feel too daunting or boring.
customer_reviews.author: Tabianne

customer_reviews.title: Get to know people better and enjoy the conversation starters!

product_meta.title: The Hygge Game - Cozy Conversation In Pleasant Company
product_meta.description: Hygge (pronounced hue-guh) is “Scandinavian” (Danish really) for enjoying the good things in life. It's a feeling of togetherness, well-being and coziness, and theres nothing more hygge than sharing a good time with friends and family. This game has more than 300 entertaining, interesting and thoughtful questions designed to spark cozy conversation, and create the right atmosphere for an ultimate hygge evening. The hygge game time is a great gift, and a perfect game for a night in, a party or a dinner with friends or family.
